revised_title: Chemical Analysis of Shell and Bone Composition
tldr: The author examines the chemical composition of shells and bones, specifically marine shells and bones of crustaceous animals. The study reveals that shells are primarily composed of carbonate of lime, while bones contain a larger portion of a more viscous gelatinous substance. The author also discovers that mother of pearl and pearls have a similar composition to shells, with a smaller proportion of carbonate of lime hardened by a membranaceous or cartilaginous substance.
